the basics / SQL School: Introduction

SQL School: Introduction

Welcome to SQL School!

Learning SQL is the first step to contributing to the Mode community. It's not too hard to learn—this tutorial will take you through the basics and only takes about 30 minutes to complete.

The entire demo is contained within Mode, so you should open up another browser window to Mode and get ready to get started.

Note: You will need to have a Mode user account in order to start the tutorial. If you do not already have one, follow the instructions on the Mode homepage to sign up.

It's also important to note that this tutorial focuses entirely on using SQL to read and analyze data—it is not a comprehensive resource for aspiring software developers (though it may be a good place to start).

When you're ready, click here to start the tutorial.

Note: All data in these tutorials is made up unless otherwise indicated

Other Ways to Learn

If you'd prefer something more lengthy and in-depth, you can check out some of these programs:

  • General Assembly
  • Udacity

If you're looking for help on how to use Mode, try our help site or jump directly to one of these lessons:

  • Write a query
  • Get data
  • SQL syntax guide
